intro: Unisema cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf plant, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are often violet or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Unisema cordata is native to tropical regions of South America and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
